lead_paragraph: A 75-year-old Buddhist monk was found hacked to death in his temple on Saturday, in a killing that bore similarities to attacks claimed by Islamist extremists.

byline.contributor: Julfikar Ali Manik reported from Cox’s Bazar, and Nida Najar from New Delhi.
byline.original: By JULFIKAR ALI MANIK and NIDA NAJAR

headline.print_headline: Buddhist Monk Is Slaughtered at His Temple in Bangladesh
headline.main: Buddhist Monk Is Slaughtered at Temple in Bangladesh

snippet: A 75-year-old Buddhist monk was found hacked to death in his temple on Saturday, in a killing that bore similarities to attacks claimed by Islamist extremists.
abstract: Police investigate killing of Buddhist monk Mong Shwe U Chak, who was found hacked to death in his temple in Bandarban district of Bangladesh; police suspect Islamist militants, but there have been no claims of responsibility.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
